challengeName: Sky Zone Android Dev Challenge - Goals
detailedRequirements:
Specifications

Welcome to the Sky Zone - Android App - Goals Challenge! The primary goal of this challenge is to allow users to view and set goals on their profile.

Project Overview

Sky Zone is developing an improved mobile experience for new and existing customers.  Overall we need to ensure that Sky Zone continues to be on the cutting edge of its user experience and stays connected to their customers when they are not at a park.  At a high level, the mobile app will be used by Sky Zone customers to further enhance their visit and relationship with Sky Zone.

The two primary goals of the app are:

  1. Making it easy for customers to purchase jump time (tickets for a Sky Zone visit), and

  2. Creating a social environment around Sky Zone that keeps customers coming back repeatedly through gamification and social conventions.

We have already helped build Sky Zone’s iOS app and now we’d like to port this over to Android.

Challenge Overview

Our main goal for this challenge is to build out the functionality around viewing and setting goals on the user’s profile within the Android app. Please see the videos below for how this currently functions in the iOS version of the app.

  • iOS Goals flow video
  • iOS Goals Progress video

Requirements

  1. Combine “Goals” and “Badges” into “My Goals” on main profile page.

  2. Build out NitroApi to work with Bunchball’s Nitro API per the requirements below.  See NitroApi.swift for example. Further Bunchball details are located towards the end of the requirements.

  3. Upon creating a new user, complete “Register App” goal:

    1. User Login

    2. Log Action

      1. tags = REGISTER_APP

      2. value = 1

      3. sessionKey

      4. userId

  4. Clicking on “My Goals” should show “My Goals” tab

    See     ViewBadgesViewController.swift for example.

 

    1. First check if Profile Height / BodyType is set in Fitness Settings.  Provide error message if not set.

    2. Get all challenges and cache.  Create list of challenges by performing a combination of requests.

      1. Admin Login

      2. Get Challenge Progress

        1. Get challenge progress for current user.

        2. Only include challenges where canAchieveChallenge == true or mainRule.completed == true

      3. Get Action History

        1. Used to add latest activity to goals (see below).

        2. Map back to Challenges returned in Get Challenge Progress.

      4. Get User Preferences

        1. Used to determine for which optional challenges the user has opted in

      5. Get Optional Challenges

        1. Get All Challenges (Admin)

        2. Build list of challenges that weren’t returned from In Progress list (see NitroApi.sortOptionalChallenges())

        3. (Combine with Challenge Progress; don’t duplicate)

        4. (tags = skyapp, monthly, jumps/calories)

    3. Monthly Challenges

      1. Optional Challenges that are in Progress

    4. Global Challenges

      1. Remaining challenges that are in progress

    5. Load goal photo in full color if achieved.

    6. Load goal photo in gray-scale if unachieved.

  2. ”View All” should show all optional goals that the user hasn’t opted into yet

   

    1. Selecting a Monthly Challenge shows Goal Details

      1. Clicking “Select Challenge” calls Set Preferences

        1. If Goal tags contain “calories”, set preferences for Rule 1 and Rule 2, in the format of “name|value”.  E.g.

          1. CalorieMonth|1 -> Name = CalorieMonth, Value = 1

          2. CalorieMonthGoal|500 -> Name = CalorieMothGoal, Value = 500

        2. If Goal tags contains “jumps”, set preferences for Rule 1 and Rule2, in the format of “name|value. E.g.

          1. JumpMonth|1 -> Name = JumpMonth, Value = 1

          2. JumpMonthGoal|15000 -> Name = JumpMothGoal, Value = 15000

      2. Return to My Goals, and refresh Goals list (requery and cache).

  2. Goal Detail Screen

   

    1. Goal Info

    2. Goal Progress preview link.  Link to progress sub-screens:

      1. Animated progress chart (X completed out of Y, % of goal)

      2. Latest Activity (graph towards goal, date of activity, from Get Action History)

      3. Goal Remaining (reverse of 1st screen)

    3. Completed goals will have “Share” option

      1. Use broadcast approach, sending image + text

  2. Display Profile Photo on Leaderboard (Manage Profile)

    1. Side Menu > Settings > My Personal Details > “Display photo on public leaderboard?” toggle

      1. User Login

      2. Set Preferences

        1. name = profileImage

        2. value = profile photo URL

Test Activity

  1. Log Jumps or Calories to count towards goals using REST calls / Postman (not currently handled in-app):

  1. User Login

  2. Log Action, e.g.

    1. tags = LOG_JUMPS

    2. value = 1234

    3. userId = [handle]

Bunchball API

Connection details are located in the repository’s Wiki here. Below is a list of API methods that will be useful in this challenge.

  • User Login
    • method = user.login
    • userId = [handle]
    • Admin Login
    • method = admin.login
  • Log Action
    • sessionKey = [sessionKey]
    • tags = [NitroActionType, e.g. REGISTER_APP, LOG_JUMPS, LOG_CALORIES]
    • userId = [handle]
    • value = [value, e.g. 1, 1234, 42]
  • Get Challenge Progress
    • method = user.getChallengeProgress
    • sessionKey = [sessionKey]
    • userId = [handle]
  • Get Action History
    • method = user.getActionHistory
    • sessionKey = [sessionKey]
    • userId = [handle]
  • Get Preferences
    • method = user.getPreferences
    • userId = [handle]
  • Get All Challenges (Admin)
    • method = admin.getChallenges
    • sessionKey = [adminSessionKey]
  • Set Preferences
    • method = user.setPreferences
    • sessionKey = [sessionKey]
    • userId = [handle]
    • names = [Pipe-delimited list of Preference names, e.g. JumpMonth|JumpMonthGoal, CalorieMonth|CalorieMonthGoal]
    • values = [Pipe-delimited list of related values, e.g. 1|15000, 1|500]
  • Get All Actions (Admin)
    • method = admin.getActionTags
    • sessionKey = [sessionKey]

Technology Overview

  • Android SDK
  • REST APIs
  • Supported Android versions: API 22 - 16.

Materials Provided and Additional Resources

  • Existing Android application
  • iOS version of app
  • iOS Goals flow video
  • iOS Goals Progress video
  • InVision iPhone prototype
  • SZE REST API
  • Bunchball connection details
  • Bunchball Postman Collection
  • Bunchball REST API Overview
  • Bunchball REST API Complete Documentation
  • RestAPITest Client

Environment Setup

  1. Use this form to add yourself to the Sky Zone GitLab group if you are not already a member.
  2. Fork the skyapp-android repository and work off of the 30051313-goals branch.
  3. Add jmartensappirio and harrywynn as members of your forked repository with Reporter access.
  4. Most design assets, including Proxima Nova font, can be found in the SkyZone-Resources repository.  A full collection of assets can be found in the existing iOS application under SkyZone-R1/Images.xcassets.
  5. If you have access to Xcode, reference the existing iOS application for latest functionality and navigation flow.
  6. The InVision prototype may be used in lieu of the above, however the iOS app takes precedence.
  7. Please use latest Android Studio (1.3) when using an IDE for development.
  8. Use the REST API Test Client for testing API calls.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Deliverables

A complete list of deliverables can be viewed in the Topcoder Assembly Competition Tutorials.

Additionally,

  1. All code should be well-commented.
  2. Code must work for Android 4.4.x, 4.1.x-4.3.x), and 4.0.3-4.0.4) (API 19 - 14).
  3. Target devices are Samsung Galaxy S4 and S5.  Tablet support is out of scope.
  4. Only portrait orientation needs to be supported.
  5. Provide a video overview of your additions to the app.

Final Submission

For each member, the final submission should be uploaded via the challenge detail page on topcoder.com.

The winner will be responsible for assisting with merging the code into our Git repo.
